data.description:
Since launching Funderbeam, we’ve helped companies raise over €4m from investors in 94 countries, on-boarded 23,000 active users, and launched 14 companies on our secondary market. 

Funderbeam works. We have great companies, great investors, and great opportunities on our platform. We’re backed and supported by some of the biggest and smartest names in the world. Now it’s time to accelerate our global expansion, and we need you to help get us from running to sprinting!

You will be responsible for getting great companies onto our platform to raise capital. You will help us build strong relationships with market stakeholders. You will be part of a top-notch international team with mind-blowing challenges and similarly sized opportunities. Plus, you’ll get to work with some of the best startups and investors in the world on a platform that is completely changing the way the investment ecosystem works. Easy, right?

You can join us either in our office in Tallinn or work remotely—apply and let's talk about what works for everyone! When you're applying, make sure your cover letter showcases your personality and motivations—we really want to see if you could be the one to help us grow!

data.description:
As our investment manager, you will be responsible for screening, analyzing and executing venture investments. You'll use your stellar networking skills to source new investments—be it through meetings, conferences, or calling on new prospects.

Your work in this exciting position will involve extensive due diligence and preparing investment memorandums and presentations. We'll also trust you to keep an eye on the performance of existing investments and prepare investor updates. 

If you already have experience with venture capital and strong ties to startup and VC communities, this could be the perfect opportunity for you to further immerse yourself in the thrilling world of venture investments. 

The position is available in either Singapore or Tokyo—apply and let's talk about the details!
data.headline: Do you feel at home in the VC space? Do you have experience with investment banking or management consulting? Are you ready for your next big challenge? Be an investment manager at Mistletoe in Tokyo or Singapore!
data.listingTitle: Manage Venture Investments at Mistletoe in Tokyo or Singapore
data.skills:
You have at least five years of experience with venture capital or early-stage private equity.
You have at least five years of experience in investment banking or management consulting OR two years of operating experience at a high-tech company, ideally in a general management, product management or business development role.
You have superior financial modeling, writing and presentation skills.
You have excellent research and organizational skills.
You're an exceptional communicator with fantastic networking skills and the ability to develop and maintain effective business relationships.
You can perform at a high level without significant supervision and with attention to detail.
You have strong, active ties to startup and VC communities.
You have the ability to interpret data and provide relevant conclusions/recommendations.
You're able to articulate your ideas clearly in a group setting.
data.tags: investment management, venture capital, VC, investments, startups, private equity, investment banking, management consulting, financial modeling, Tokyo, Japan, Singapore, Asia, Southeast Asia, East Asia
data.tasks:
Source new venture investments by meeting with founders and entrepreneurs, attending conferences and networking events, and calling on new prospects
Conduct detailed industry, business and financial due diligence on prospective investments 
Prepare in-depth financial and data analysis for potential investments, including customer and management references, market sizing and mapping, and industry research
Develop financial models relating to financing, restructuring, valuation analyses and liquidity events
Prepare thorough investment memorandums and presentations
Develop investment themes within the venture investment sector
Maintain knowledge of existing investments and monitor financial performance
Prepare quarterly investment analysis and write-ups of existing deals for investor and management reporting
Support portfolio company management teams in special projects

data.description:
Are you passionate about travel, people, and technology? We are looking for a talented, energetic, results-oriented person who loves working in a fast-paced, multinational environment. As a contact center team leader, you will support business objectives and act as a motivator and decision maker to ensure the group is working efficiently as a unit.

In this position, you will work closely with the operations management team and other departments within Agoda's Customer Experience Group (CEG) to support our contact center. You'll provide directions, instructions, and guidance to our customer care specialists. You'll develop a deep understanding of the team members’ strengths, weaknesses, and motivations.

The position requires you to coach our contact center agents and provide valuable input on processes to our operations team. You will also be expected to contribute with ideas for continuous organizational and employee skills development but also at the global level impacting our international contact center network.

data.description:
We're looking for a digital marketing rockstar to join our food tech startup as we launch across Asia. If you're looking to seriously grow your career, this role is perfect for you. You'll grow and hone your skill set promoting our company, and you'll also be our in-house consultant for some of Asia's most successful restaurant brands.

The right person for this role is a passionate and experienced digital marketing professional ready for the ultimate startup experience. 

As our digital marketing champion, you should be well versed with both B2B and B2C marketing. You will be responsible for the company’s B2B marketing initiatives and also act as a B2C marketing consultant for our clients. This exciting role will allow you to advise our clients on their marketing strategy and become the point of contact for any topics concerning marketing. You are also then expected to devise and implement a solid B2B marketing strategy for Ginja.

If that sounds like your kind of challenge, apply now and let's get to know each other!

data.description:
Platonics is currently perfecting the first 3D printer designed with architects, for architects. We aim to eliminate the thresholds that prevent architects from using 3D printing in their daily work by being user-friendly, fast and easy to use. We are currently testing our printer with the leading architecture offices in Finland and preparing to release our product in fall 2017.

Do you have marketing experience and an interest in working at a fast-growing startup? We're looking for a versatile marketing manager to plan, execute and manage all our day-to-day marketing activities and strategy. Your main responsibility for the coming year is introducing our product to the international market and supporting our company goals with marketing. This position is for a creative and strategically-minded individual who is not afraid to take initiative—you’ll have control of the whole marketing function.

Interested in taking up the challenge? When applying, don't forget your cover letter and a content sample that best displays your skills, whether it's a blog post, article, video, or social media updates. Don’t hesitate to apply if you don’t meet all the requirements—personality matters most!

data.description:
We are Southeast Asia’s one-stop shopping destination having consolidated millions of products and promotions from leading local and international online shops into a single discovery engine. Having successfully closed our Series A funding round last year, iPrice is designed to become the largest Southeast Asian aggregator for retail shopping. With a motivated team of more than 120 people, we have amassed a catalog of over 70 million products and reached more than 10 million shoppers.

Business intelligence is central to the growth of our business, as it provides us with the non-financial data granularity required to understand the levers of growth and how to best pull them to increase revenue. Finance, on the other hand, deals with all the financial/accounting processes and data with a high focus on the costs-side of the business to ensure that our growth is profitable and sustainable.

As such, collectively, the BI and finance teams cover all the key components of our business and are pivotal to our overall continued success. We are looking for a highly analytical, driven, and curious data guru with a strong knowledge of accounting to join us.

As a business intelligence and finance analyst at iPrice, you will have the opportunity to help one of Southeast Asia’s fastest-growing businesses scale in a booming e-commerce market. With access to one of the region’s largest and most robust databases, encompassing everything from consumer demographics to on-site behavior, you will use the latest cutting-edge BI systems to help our management team make the right business decisions. You will also use accounting software and liaise with service providers and internal teams to manage our expenses, our balance sheet, and our cash flow.

With an internationally-sourced superstar management team combining experience from BCG, Microsoft, Google, Siemens, BMO and other world-class organizations, iPrice is well positioned for continued success and we want you to be a part of it!
data.destination: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

data.description:
Our mission is to become the largest lead generator for e-commerce in Southeast Asia. With more than 1000 partners on our platform, 130 employees, and 10M monthly page views, we are well set up to achieve our goal this year. But we're hungry for more. With e-commerce in SEA still in its infancy compared to mature markets like Japan, Europe or America, we believe we can play a bigger role in the ecosystem.

We're ready to take the next step. To that end, we are looking for a passionate product owner who can drive this change and lead our product team to the next level. As owner of a topic, you'll be in the driver's seat—and we like to go fast. Contribute to the vision of iPrice and break it down into tangible data-driven steps. Excel in execution in a multi-cultural environment where team work and collaboration is the key ingredient for success.

With an internationally-sourced superstar management team, combining experience from world-class organizations (such as BCG, Microsoft, Zalora, Apple, IBM) with local talent and insights from the 7 countries we operate in, iPrice is well-positioned for continued success and we want you to be a part of it!

data.description:
We are Southeast Asia’s one stop shopping destination, having consolidated millions of products and promotions from leading local and international online shops into a single discovery engine. Having successfully closed our Series A funding round last year, iPrice is designed to become the largest Southeast Asian aggregator for retail shopping. data.description:
As Head of Product at NEXD, you will be responsible for a range of products, including the Adcanvas Self-Service Platform, Adcanvas creative templates, and more. Working closely with our Business Development, Sales and IT teams, you will help plan, prioritize and manage the flow of requirements and tasks across the entire product development pipeline.

A key part of this role will be to define, manage and continually assess the methodology used to collate information and requests from business development and sales. You’ll need to build product requirements and define the process for breaking these requirements down into tasks that can then be carried out by the IT team. You will then oversee the implementation, testing, and communication of these product developments, both internally and to our customers.

As a person, you should be hyper-organized and experienced in managing a team of developers, and have a deep understanding of planning, building and managing SaaS-type products (ideally in the digital advertising sector). 

We’re looking for someone customer-focused with strong operational experience when it comes to managing the minutiae of product development. If that sounds like you, apply today!

data.description:
We're seeking an iOS developer who can craft awesome native iOS apps. Due to our unique environment in terms of having our own ecosystem of applications that support the business, working with us in a technical role is a great challenge. Any technical role at Mindvalley will provide a good mix of development work, systems thinking, problem-solving, and business analysis with a large dose of teamwork. 

We generally look for attitude over aptitude when it comes to technical skills. A history of proven execution and excellent root cause analysis problem-solving skills are things that we value highly. We predominantly build apps with an nginx, Unicorn, Ruby, Redis and PostgreSQL architecture on Linode so experience with any of these will be valuable to us. 

We run functional teams based on the SCRUM methodology and are a fairly Agile environment, with two-week sprints and teams with a minimum of 2 developers (preferably 3) plus a Platform Owner. Sprints can't be interrupted and work is planned out well in advance to keep stress down to a minimum. We have a focus on scalability, stability and code quality and we use tools such as Circle-CI and Code Climate to help with that. We ensure full test coverage for everything important and line-by-line code reviews for every pull request on Github—this maintains code quality and keeps everyone in the loop and learning.

To thrive in this role, you should be more than just a developer—someone who understands that a great app must do great things while being simple and intuitive. You are pixel-perfect, knowing that a pixel to the right is not merely a pixel to the right. You understand that organized code with well-applied design patterns will make a difference. You are fascinated with technology and eager to learn everything you can, applying the coolest and most amazing techniques there are. You always add your own magic touch that dazzles your users.

Being one of our talented developers, you'll have an opportunity to learn, grow, and be a key part of creating our products. Check out http://www.mindvalley.com/quests/ for our latest release. 

We believe work needs to be fun, educational and something that makes so excited that you jump out of bed each morning. You'll be exposed to some of the best knowledge, people, and resources available anywhere, which you can apply to your own projects and become much more employable. 

We're looking for people with a passion for technology, who want to have an impact and don't mind getting their hands dirty. If this is you, don't delay—jump on this opportunity now! When you apply, make sure to include links to software, mobile apps, your coding samples, or your web designs and portfolio so we can see proof of your talents.

data.description:
One of the company values we uphold at Piktochart is being user-focused, and we talk to our users often to understand their pain points, as well as what makes them happy or frustrated. Our UX researchers do this the most and are passionate about getting to know users and creating the best experience for them. If this sounds like you, we want to hear from you!

This is a full-time role based in Penang, Malaysia, and we're not offering remote working.

data.skills:
You have at least 3 years of experience in the UX field.
You have a firm grasp of user-centered design and testing methodologies, subsystems, and usability and accessibility concerns.
You're creative in coming up with ways to collect data and proficient in analyzing the data that has been collected.
You're an excellent communicator in speech and in writing.
Passionate about all things UX and other areas of design and innovation, you can showcase your knowledge in the industry’s latest trends and technologies.
You're data-driven and make decisions based on methods of “Test, Build, Measure” and repeat.
You can translate user findings into design suggestions and articulate the values well.
You adapt well to new team formations as UX researchers often rotate amongst project teams to identify best experience solutions for each feature and goal.
Bold like a superhero, you don't shy away from spending most of your time on phone/video calls with users.
You have a strong dose of curiosity and eagerness to know the whys.
You stand up again and again after failure and rejection—being a researcher often means striving hard to get volunteers for tests, not receiving expected results, or working on ideas that end up not performing up to par. At Piktochart, we strive to innovate every day, and failure only helps us move forward!

Define Piktochart’s user persona and the Jobs to Be Done.

Create effective user flow and wireframes that solve problems faced by users, and propose changes or new ideas to designers and developers.

This year we decided to achieve a consistent seamless experience through all our available touch points (web platforms, mobile apps, blog, email, social media and advertising and more). And we're looking for a digital marketing specialist who will be in charge of creating our Hubspot ecosystem, ensuring that all teams using Hubspot utilize its features to the fullest.

Our website is one of the most important assets of our business, which is why we decided to move our pages to Hubspot, a platform that helps us to modify websites, attract visitors, convert leads, and close customers.

data.description:
Ginja gives restaurants all the digital tools they need to set up multi-channel online ordering, including apps, websites, integrations with delivery providers, and payment systems. We are entering a unique phase of product development as we expand across Southeast Asia and service the hundreds of restaurants that have already signed up for our platform. 

Now is the perfect time to join our team as we strategize and develop what we believe is the next paradigm in food tech. We practice agile processes and encourage a strong culture of participation and mentorship. The team loves quality code and are big believers in regular unit testing and code reviews. 

Ginja’s technology stack is a RESTful JSON API (Laravel) backend, with Ionic 3 and Angular powering our mobile apps and responsive websites. While expertise in specific technologies is important, we place more emphasis on finding team members with a balanced understanding of the development process and a hunger to learn and hone their skills. 

Ginja’s head office is based in Bangkok, one of the most thriving metropolitan cities in SEA, boasting an incredibly diverse range of international food, friendly expats, and unique cultural experiences. Daily life in this vibrant city is both comfortable and affordable, and when you feel like a change of scenery, there are plenty of exotic holiday destinations only a short flight away.

Bangkok is also the hub for Asia’s most innovative startups, offering you the opportunity to network and establish connections with innovative tech companies across the region. Join our team and you will work alongside a multicultural group of industry professionals committed to building disruptive tech for a global market. 

We are recruiting worldwide and will provide some of the cost and assistance with relocating to Thailand.
data.headline: Full-stack engineers, your skills are wanted at Ginja in the vibrant city of Bangkok! Architect scalable web solutions and mentor a team of developers at a startup that is spicing up the food tech space!

data.description:
The current team consists of engineers and designers split over five scrum teams and three supporting teams (DevOps, data engineering and quality assurance); towards the end of 2017, our aim is to grow to seven scrum teams.

The technology powering StudyPortals’ platform is based on object-oriented PHP5; virtually all of our systems have been developed in-house. We are currently transitioning into a service-oriented architecture, powered by our own RESTful API. In parallel, we are scaling our infrastructure out into AWS in order to get maximum benefit out of the large variety of infrastructure-as-a-service approaches currently offered.

As a back-end engineer on our team, you will play an important role in further developing and rolling out our RESTful API, which will be at the base of all our current and future products. Your responsibilities range from working on the core of our systems all the way up to producing proof-of-concept web applications.

Not only will you be extending our existing API, but you’ll also be building new API’s, micro-services and (micro-)applications following infrastructure-as-code principles. You, together with your scrum team, will take full ownership of these applications, all the way from their inception up to maintaining and monitoring their continued well-being.

As we are scaling our systems, and especially while we move towards full continuous delivery, new approaches to ensuring we deliver quality software are required. At StudyPortals we are greatly interested in applying the principles of test-driven development more structurally and we are thus looking for engineers with proven previous experience in this field. We hope you can help us in changing both our approach and our mindset to help us properly put test-driven development in practice.

Please note that a proven-track record in the field of test-driven development is a hard requirement for this position. If you want to join our team but don’t have any experience with test-driven development, please have a look at our other engineering positions!
data.headline: To support their global expansion, StudyPortals is significantly expanding their engineering team. If you're a back-end engineer with solid test-driven development experience, you should keep reading.

You have experience with writing and/or maintaining complex PHP5 applications.

data.description:
If you are a digital marketer obsessed with quality and ready to challenge the status quo, we want you to join us! At Mindvalley, we design learning experiences and publish teachings by the best authors in transformational education for over three million students worldwide.

And we need your help.

As a team, we maintain and improve user and customer journeys through main communication channels by using an omnichannel approach. We have many ways of interacting with customers—web platforms, multiple mobile apps, blogs, email, social media, and advertising to name a few touch points.

We need you to be in charge of our email marketing strategy, managing and growing an email list of millions, designing email funnels and campaigns, implementing industry standards and best practices. You'll also be in charge of important email setups and keeping track of our email metrics.

When you're applying, don't forget your resume and a video cover letter. Record yourself speaking in a 3-minute video and upload it to YouTube. Also send us examples of work you're proud of so we can see proof of your talents!

data.description:
We’re looking for a creative, experienced, and motivated developer to help scale our product suite across Kenya. You should be excited about the prospect of taking a leadership role in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment, interested in helping galvanize a budding tech community, and have a penchant for adventure. You will be joining a small, enthusiastic tech team of 3-4 people during a period of aggressive scaling across the region. As such, you’ll have the opportunity to make a large and visible impact on our company and the autonomy to build our tech to thrive at scale.

You should be able to demonstrate that you can learn quickly, adapt to changing circumstances, and rise to the challenge of difficult tasks you might not have experience solving.

In addition to your main responsibilities, you'll be able to take on projects you're passionate about. Our philosophy is that you should work on things that excite you most. Obviously, this has	to align at least somewhat	with our business priorities, but we're flexible!

We understand that moving to East Africa is a big decision. That's why we’re offering a variable term contract, so you can decide how long you’d like to stay. That said, we do require a 6-month minimum commitment and suggest you stay at least a year.
data.headline: Interested in solving challenging, high-impact problems? Come help lead our small, passionate team working to drive quantifiable change in primary care in East Africa through data-driven software. You'll have the opportunity to help transform our startup into a company serving millions of people, all while spending weekends in tropical paradise or on the best safaris in the world.

data.skills:
You have a BS or MS in computer science, software engineering or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.
You have 2+ years of experience in either mobile or web development.
You have at least a year of experience in a leadership role or can demonstrate the required software development and personal skills to excel in a leadership role.
You have experience scaling mobile or web products.
You have experience working on a full software stack.
Some Android experience is required.
Experience with Node.js and/or Python is a plus.
Data science experience is a plus.
You can evaluate and prioritize a long list of dependent and independent tasks based on business and technical constraints.
You write clean, well-documented code.
You have effective problem-solving skills, including decision-making and time management.
You're entrepreneurial by nature, with a lot of creativity, resourcefulness, and a sense of humor.

data.tags: mobile, web, Node.js, Python, fullstack, full stack, Android, data science, leadership, Nairobi, Kenya, Africa, East Africa
data.tasks:
You'll help scale our Android app and server-side components (we’re building micro-services primarily in Node and Python) to support our growing client base.
You'll help build and develop tools to support streamlined and quality supply chains and integrated financing for medications in an environment where up to 1/3 of medications in the country do not meet international quality standards.
You'll develop our server-side and client-side patient care technology. This includes building out our intelligent SMS health tips platform and developing analytics pipelines to feed critical health information back to our clients.
You'll develop our analytics and data processing tools so we can provide insights into previously invisible market trends and generate novel data on health trends, patient behaviour and prescribing habits at scale.

data.description:
This position is available in either Tallinn or Berlin—apply and let's talk about what will work best!

We're looking for a head of technical account management to deliver performance and scale the Adcanvas product globally. You'll be the leader of the TAM function responsible for onboarding prospects coming halfway through the sales cycle who now need testing, training, and onboarding. Specifically, you'll be responsible for maintaining, developing and growing strategic client relationships.  

This role requires technical aptitude and a strong understanding of the digital advertising landscape, ideally for programmatic, creative and mobile. You will be responsible for maximizing the usage of our platform with a wide number of clients in the region including top-tier advertising agencies and mobile-specific planning and buying specialists and publishers.

You should have a consultative style, coupled with the structure and organizational skills needed to drive a long adoption cycle. In addition to having excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and good follow-through, you should be self-motivated and highly goal-oriented to achieve ambitious plans for Adcanvas.

This is a demanding role and you will need to work well under pressure, managing your own workload. If that sounds like your cup of tea, we want to hear from you!

data.description:
We are building new platforms, hiring more quickly than ever, and attracting more and more customers with our ethical and responsible approach. That means this is a particularly exciting time to join us. 

Your goal in this role will be to ensure solutions are developed from day one with quality in mind. Quality engineers know how things work and are always striving to improve them—and that's what we'll trust you to do. As a QE at MYJAR, you will be an integral part of a cross-functional team including product owners, architects, software engineers and content managers.

This is a job for someone who strives for excellence and is highly driven in developing software with the highest quality. Confident and articulate in expressing your ideas, you should be able to work with teams from different cultural backgrounds and across multiple geographic locations. Top that off with a sense of personal ownership with the ability to deliver to tight deadlines, and there's our next brilliant quality engineer. Is that you? data.description:
We're looking for a best-in-class product designer to work strategically with our UX/UI and operationally with our UI patterns. We need a designer who bridges user needs, product strategy and development. We are looking for someone highly skilled, who can lead Actimo to a world-class SaaS design comparable to the likes of GetFeedback.com, Falcon.io and intercom.com. This is a truly challenging position for a designer who wants to be part of an amazing journey at a dynamic and expanding tech company.

At Actimo, we have a strong commitment to our four core values: Engaging, Easy, Effective and Fast. Identifying with these values and seeing them as an integral part of technology is essential. Colleagues should perceive you as engaging in what you do. You are easy to communicate with and get things done on time. Lastly, you understand that speed is a necessity in most business interactions.

While a good sense of team spirit is important, to succeed and thrive in this role, you must also be a strong-minded individual with an appetite for setting a solid course for the development and implementation of the design, which will underpin the continued success of Actimo. You are self-motivated, energetic and optimistic about the future. If that sounds like you, apply now!

data.description:
At Actimo, we strive to have an easy and engaging tone of voice in any touch point where we meet new or existing customers. 

We believe that great content can effectively tell the right story and motivate, nudge, and guide customers. We imagine that content marketing, great interface micro-copy, easy-to-understand screen support, and a coherent and identifiable tone of voice are key to our success. As you may have guessed from our existing copy and content, you will play a central role in making Actimo a great experience. 

The job is placed in the Product Department in Copenhagen, which also includes Product Management and Product Design. Our closest internal partners-in-crime are Tech, Customer Success, and Marketing.  

At Actimo, we have a strong commitment to our four core values: Engaging, Easy, Effective and Fast. Identifying with these values and seeing them as an integral part of technology is essential. Colleagues should perceive you as engaging in what you do. You are easy to communicate with and get things done on time. Lastly, you understand that speed is a necessity in most business interactions.

data.description:
We are looking for a system administrator with excellent Linux knowledge. You will work in a team to build and maintain the infrastructure behind Car Rental Gateway.

Car Rental Gateway works as a gateway between suppliers (like Hertz, Avis, Sixt) and distributors (like Expedia, Rentalcars). End customers search for a car through a distributor and we pass the request to multiple suppliers, make the response readable and understandable, and pass it to the end customer.

Currently, we're handling about 10 million incoming API requests a day and sending out about 30 million API calls a day to suppliers. To handle this load, we have more than 80 VM instances running in AWS. Some of the technologies we use:

HaProxy
Nginx + PHP FPM application
MariaDB cluster
MongoDB cluster
GlusterFS cluster
Docker Swarm cluster
Redis Sentinel
Memcached
Elasticsearch cluster
Logstash
Zabbix
Puppet with Foreman
AWS services like Redshift, Elastic Load Balancer

If you're looking for an opportunity to take on exciting challenges and accomplish big things, this is it. Apply now and let's talk!

data.description:
At Piktochart we believe in generosity. We believe in providing people with genuine and rich experiences that inspire them. Not once, not twice... but consistently. We strongly believe that showing up with a mentality to give is the most effective way to build trust—you know, the stuff that makes or breaks a business. Doing so requires an innate understanding of our users—and that’s where you come into the picture!

As the marketing insight campaigner at Piktochart, your role will start with understanding our user journey (we like to refer to our users as Visual Heroes). We’d like you to get into our Visual Heroes’ minds and map out their ideal journey. What makes them stay? What makes them want to use us again and again (and again!). How can we replicate this journey so that budding visual storytellers sign up for our product and existing ones keep trusting us?

This will help you unlock the rest of your role which will be focused on crafting and experimenting with customized email drip campaigns that will fit every stage of the Visual Hero’s journey to success. You will also be responsible for designing the funnel for newsletter subscribers, creating content for landing pages fitted to every Visual Hero’s needs and crafting email campaigns for our new, exciting product launches. You will also experiment, experiment (and then experiment some more) to help drive more signups.

Your role will require curiosity, drive for experimentation, creativity and a great dose of storytelling. You also shouldn't be intimidated by data and spreadsheets.

This position is based in Barcelona, Spain. Our team of 50 is mostly based at Piktochart's HQ in Penang, Malaysia, with 10% of the team working remotely from all around the world.
data.headline: Do you know the ins and outs of managing email campaigns? Do you write clever copy and love experimenting with new, unexpected solutions? Piktochart is looking for someone based in Barcelona to understand and improve their user journeys. Ready for the challenge?
data.listingTitle: Shape User Journeys at Piktochart in Barcelona
data.skills:
You have hands-on experience in managing email campaigns from start to finish.
Ideally, you have a knowledge of email providers such as MailChimp, Intercom, etc.
You have great copywriting skills and are proficient in English (native or close to native).
You enjoy writing clever copy and have written web copy before (blog, email, social).
You have a holistic understanding of conversion optimization, email marketing, content marketing, and SEM.
You have a drive for experimentation and enjoy testing out different approaches. 
You learn fast and tweak your strategy as you go. 
You have experience in A/B testing.
You have a data-driven mindset and are used to analyzing and interpreting various data points before making decisions. 
You are no stranger to Google Analytics, AdWords and/or Kissmetrics
Always curious, you ask a lot of questions and are not afraid to challenge the status quo.
You love trying out creative new solutions.
Know-how in managing paid ads (Google AdWords) is a big plus.
You have a passion for improving your craft and your marketing skills. 
You are eligible to work in Spain.
data.tags: marketing, user journeys, drip campaigns, email, email marketing, copy, copywriting, writing, conversion optimization, content marketing, SEM, SEO, PPC, blog, email, social, remote, Barcelona, Catalonia, Spain, Europe, EU, European Union
data.tasks:
Understand and improve our user journeys (what makes a product sticky for a successful user and how we can acquire more users of such profile as well as guide the existing ones to success better).
Amplify content reach via email campaigns (you will be experimenting with personalized drip campaigns for some of our big content guides).
Design the funnel for email subscribers (who signed up via the blog).
Design email drips to fit the user journey and experiment with ways to track user retention
A/B split test and experiment with email drips.
Create landing page content for specific use cases (to build stronger SEO presence for long tail keywords).
PPC campaigns to amplify big content launches.
Designing campaigns for product launches.
Perform small experiments on the landing pages, homepage, blog and other places to improve conversions.

data.description:
To achieve our ambitious mission and take Sorry as a Service to the next level, we need your help. We're looking for an experienced fundraiser and good communicator with experience building international teams (ideally, sales and marketing teams in particular).

This is an exciting opportunity to learn fast and grow even faster at a startup with an already impressive presence in Europe. Not to brag (although we're about to), but Sorry as a Service took part in one of the world's best accelerators—Techstars London 2015. Since then, we’ve built up an amazing team that’s keen to share their knowledge and learn from you in return.

We're not going to lie—we're going through some crazy changes, taking a lot of risks, and raising funds, so the next few months are going to be a wild ride. If you love the thrill of the startup life, you'll love working with us in Tallinn, one of Europe's top startup hubs.

data.description:
As our Global Manager of Customer Satisfaction Team (CSAT/ESC) in the Customer Experience Group (CEG), you'll provide vision, leadership, and guidance to associates in the key operating areas through performance and goal-setting globally. We'll trust you to communicate effectively with your team, developing a climate in which information is shared openly. Clearly defining team goals and expectations and developing tactical plans to reach them, you'll provide solid leadership for your team.

You will be based in our Kuala Lumpur office, leading a team of more than 50 people globally. You will become a part of a dynamic and international team, working with most of the key leadership team based in each country.
data.destination: Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

data.skills:
You have at least 12-15 years of experience in a BPO/contact center environment.
You have at least 8 years of experience as a senior supervisor, junior manager or manager.
You're at least a college graduate (4-year course) with a university degree.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.
You're tech savvy with knowledge of PC applications.
You can work with very minimal guidance or supervision in a time-critical environment.
You have strong time management skills.
You can work in both a team environment and autonomously.
You have a strong track record of evaluating, analyzing, implementing, leading, and monitoring effective and efficient processes to proactively improve the efficiency of escalation management and staff performance.
You have excellent personal and interpersonal skills to interact with a variety of individuals, including building strong partnerships with other departments.
You can handle multiple projects and effectively manage different timelines.
You're an assertive team player with high energy to work in a fast-paced environment.
data.tags: customer satisfaction, customer experience, CX, leadership, management, manager, Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, Asia, Southeast Asia
data.tasks:
You'll maintain and improve call center operations by monitoring system performance, identifying and resolving problems, preparing and competing action plans, completing system audits and analyses, managing system and process improvement and quality assurance programs, and installing upgrades.
You'll prepare call center performance reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing data and trends.
You'll ensure that customer satisfaction specialists are empowered and the team handles escalations accordingly and in a timely manner, delivering high-level service to partners in order to build productive and continuing relationships.
You'll empower associates to learn, develop and adapt to a constantly changing work environment by continuously reviewing team performance, identifying and appropriately addressing opportunities for improvement, determining training requirements, ensuring timely and effective training is delivered to enhance skills of the team, and implementing initiatives and processes to improve all aspects of the department.
You'll research and analyze root causes of problems, identify trends and recurring problems, and suggest resolutions.
You'll review plans and proposals created by customer satisfaction specialists and suggest leadership and executive programs for the team leaders.
You'll respond to escalated inquiries, complaints, and disputes from customers and internal business partners, and develop and manage the escalation management procedure in line with business requirements and develop a detailed plan accordingly.
You'll oversee workflow management and quality of work, ensuring overall compliance with government regulations/local laws.
You'll manage escalations by being the point of contact for the department, implementation and closure of all corrective and preventive actions (both internal and external for post incident), setting appropriate expectations, owning the action plan through resolution, communicating, and documenting the escalations.
You'll manage the real-time investigation and risk mitigation on product and services related as required with other departments.
You'll manage complaints and information requests from regulatory authorities including ensuring process and documentation are completed promptly.
You'll effectively lead and manage a team and coordinate with other branches, to ensure SLA adherence and quality resolutions.
Bring order, structure, and focused management attention to customers' and partners' problems.
